title: How to Pass the Vanilla Domes Castle on Super Mario World (on Gameboy Advance)

steps.headline: Power up at the Top Secret Area before you enter the castle.
steps.description: This is located in the northwest corner of the Donut Plains, directly above the Donut Ghost House. You can visit it throughout  the game to get mushrooms, Yoshi, fire flowers, feathers, and 1-ups as needed.

steps.headline: Enter the castle and encounter Magikoopa.
steps.description: Magikoopa is your first enemy and his weapon is magic. You can defeat him temporarily by jumping on his head or by throwing a shell at him. He always comes back after a couple of minutes as long as you remain in his area. Wait a few seconds upon first entering the castle and Magikoopa will destroy one of the rotating blocks in your vicinity. This will allow you to drop down and proceed to the next section of the castle.

steps.headline: Get a few useful items.
steps.description: Break the rotating blocks to get a fire flower, a feather, and a 1 up. Just be careful when you grab these items -- don't fall into the hot lava!

steps.headline: Get a feather.
steps.description: Get the feather from the question mark square at the end of the rotating block area and defeat Magikoopa so that you may complete the next couple of steps without him getting in your way.

steps.headline: Pass through the area with water along the bottom and find the floating door.
steps.description: It will be surrounded by coins. Get all the coins from the sides, but leave at least one or two under the door.

steps.headline: Go back and get the P Switch from the top row of blocks above the water.
steps.description: Just grab it and move forward with it.

steps.headline: Carry the P Switch to the platform just beyond the floating door and jump on it.
steps.description: The coins under the door will turn to blocks that you can stand on.

steps.headline: Enter the floating door to find the midway marker for the castle and a 1-up block.
steps.description: You may still defeat the castle without doing this, but passing the midway marker allows you to avoid starting over at the beginning of the map every time Mario bites the dust. If you die, you'll start there next time.

steps.headline: Head down a short corridor to an area that combines moving walls, floors and ceilings with lots of lava.
Pass through the moving maze by taking a couple of minutes to observe the full cycle of movement for each screen.
steps.description: As you are watching, the best route for Mario to take will be revealed. You'll see where you need to jump and when to avoid getting crushed.

steps.headline: Follow the small corridor at the end of this area to a big red door at the bottom of some stairs.
steps.description: You will also find a green switch block containing a feather. Grab it.

steps.headline: Enter the big red door to Lemmy Koopa's lair.
steps.description: This contains a row of orange pipes. Lemmy and two of his friends will rise out of the pipes in random order and then will duck back down again at short intervals.

steps.headline: Defeat Lemmy.
steps.description: You can do this by locating him and jumping on his head before he sinks back into the pipes and pops up somewhere else. You have to jump on him three times to vanquish the castle and proceed to the Twin Bridges area.

steps.headline: Move on.
steps.description: Pat yourself on the back and get ready for the next adventure!

text: Power up at the Top Secret Area before you enter the castle. This is located in the northwest corner of the Donut Plains, directly above the Donut Ghost House. You can visit it throughout  the game to get mushrooms, Yoshi, fire flowers, feathers, and 1-ups as needed. Enter the castle and encounter Magikoopa. Magikoopa is your first enemy and his weapon is magic. You can defeat him temporarily by jumping on his head or by throwing a shell at him. He always comes back after a couple of minutes as long as you remain in his area. Wait a few seconds upon first entering the castle and Magikoopa will destroy one of the rotating blocks in your vicinity. This will allow you to drop down and proceed to the next section of the castle. Get a few useful items. Break the rotating blocks to get a fire flower, a feather, and a 1 up. Just be careful when you grab these items -- don't fall into the hot lava! Get a feather. Get the feather from the question mark square at the end of the rotating block area and defeat Magikoopa so that you may complete the next couple of steps without him getting in your way. Pass through the area with water along the bottom and find the floating door. It will be surrounded by coins. Get all the coins from the sides, but leave at least one or two under the door. Go back and get the P Switch from the top row of blocks above the water. Just grab it and move forward with it. Carry the P Switch to the platform just beyond the floating door and jump on it. The coins under the door will turn to blocks that you can stand on. Enter the floating door to find the midway marker for the castle and a 1-up block. You may still defeat the castle without doing this, but passing the midway marker allows you to avoid starting over at the beginning of the map every time Mario bites the dust. If you die, you'll start there next time. Head down a short corridor to an area that combines moving walls, floors and ceilings with lots of lava. Move carefully. Pass through the moving maze by taking a couple of minutes to observe the full cycle of movement for each screen. As you are watching, the best route for Mario to take will be revealed. You'll see where you need to jump and when to avoid getting crushed. Follow the small corridor at the end of this area to a big red door at the bottom of some stairs. You will also find a green switch block containing a feather. Grab it. Enter the big red door to Lemmy Koopa's lair. This contains a row of orange pipes. Lemmy and two of his friends will rise out of the pipes in random order and then will duck back down again at short intervals. Defeat Lemmy. You can do this by locating him and jumping on his head before he sinks back into the pipes and pops up somewhere else. You have to jump on him three times to vanquish the castle and proceed to the Twin Bridges area. Move on. Pat yourself on the back and get ready for the next adventure!
